website_summaries.verdict: A basic portable grill design that users can get creative with, thanks to its good-size cooking surface, deep charcoal chamber, and hands-free, hinged lid.
pros: The hinged lid is a highlight of this table-top grill, sealing well and opening easily
Locking handle doubles as carrying handle
Good bottom ventilation and even heat across grill surface
cons: Space between grill surface and lid is a bit tight
Charcoal grate tends to warp and rust over time

customer_reviews.title: When I split with my girlfriend she took my favorite bbq grill
customer_reviews.text: When I split with my girlfriend she took my favorite bbq grill, I beg her to let me keep my bbq. Let me tell you something, never tough that I will found the perfect bbq grill. B*** , you can keep that old s***, I got now the PERFECT bbq grill that I ever had and you are not going to eat my hamburgers again. Perfect size! I even buy the accessories with it. I hope that you’re smelling my bbq’s now bit****. HA!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and still portable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bigger cooking surface but still regain portability and the SJJ is perfect, there was a chip in the coating inside the kettle by one of the leg fastening holes but nothing i would go thru the trouble of sending it back for, overall its a perfect Grill for home or camping and the locking lid is a big plus
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Little powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: you will be amazed with the amount of food you can grill/smoke with this. Use a brick to indirect cook with charcoal and soaked wood chips for great smoking results. I added the temp gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Tnansel23

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: I stopped half way through assembly just now to write this review. The grill arrived only a couple hours ago. Okay, so what do we have here?? Assembly instructions that are completely incoherent, I guarantee you that the man who made the instructions manual was absolutely plastered. Wait, it gets better. What should I mention next, parts that are damaged or parts that are missing?? Yeah, in every possible way, this grill is a FAIL!!!! ONE STAR only because I can not give ZERO!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is the perfect size for what I needed. I have a gas grill and a 22" WSM. I wanted something that didn't take up much room, was portable, and most importantly, able to give that charcoal flavor! Much like other reviewers have noted, you would be surprised how much food you can fit on this thing. I also purchased the Weber 60540 Charcoal Thermometer and mounted it in the hood, near the vent, using a step drill bit - 3/8", I believe.
customer_reviews.author: prepsphere

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an apartment dweller
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment with limited storage space, so I wanted a charcoal grill that would fit in our storage unit downstairs. I purchased this grill after seeing a friend do wonders with a full sized version. I've found this grill very functional. It holds heat very well and distributes heat evenly. It's just large enough to pile coals on one side if cooking for a smaller group, but for a bigger group you might want to stick to things that don't need to be seared. The grill has held up for a couple years, and the only complaint is that the handle comes loose every couple of uses (easily fixed by tightening from the inside when cooled).
customer_reviews.author: frozenfrog

customer_reviews.title: What a Shame for Weber name
customer_reviews.text: They did not provide enough wing nuts and screws to install this properly. Called customer support and the automatic phone service dropped my call. No way to get missing parts. This is nothing but a cheap Chinese Trash sold by Weber. What a SHAME! BTW, the instruction manual is a joke! The app was ok.
customer_reviews.author: MB2008

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: The Jumbo Joe is a great product that is both portable and versatile. It able to handle quite a lot of food on its 240 square inch surface. However, it lacks several features that need to be purchased separately to maximize its abilities. One is adding a thermometer which is helpful in knowing that you have reached optimal temperature. 2nd, Charcoal baskets which make it easier for offset or indirect cooking during smoking. 3rd, Hinged Cooking Grate to make adding more charcoal or smoking chips or chunks easier. Totally optional is adding grillgrates to get fantastic grill marks, a flat top when needed, and higher heat for faster cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Gregersen

customer_reviews.title: Lid too Shallow
customer_reviews.text: I love weber grills. I've had maybe 5 or more in my life. I have always used the 14" size since that is all my local store stocked. I've always had trouble cooking a rack of ribs and baked potatoes on the 14" using indirect heat because stacking taters on top of the ribs would interfere with the lid placement. If the lid on the 14 was 1 to 1 1/2 inches deeper it wouldn't be a problem. I bought this 18" to solve this problem and now I'm thinking I can comfortably cook for 2 using indirect heat but the lid really isn't deep (tall) enough to stack much food. I wish Weber would make taller/deeper lids an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To Get That Good Ole Barbecue Flavor, You Need This
customer_reviews.text: Even though we have an electric JennAir Grill on our outside patio, I decided to buy this Weber portable grill for steaks and chicken to get the taste of real barbecue flavor. This is a great little grill and is fairly easy to clean up once you get the routine down. I also found out that to really get my coals going so I could time the meat, I needed to purchase the Weber Chimney that really accelerates the lighting of the brickettes. I also need to purchase the big glove and cleaning brush that Weber sells on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. GilmoreTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Weber Jumbo Joe 18 inch Grill
customer_reviews.text: I find this little Grill very useful one we want to go and barbecue at the park or the beach. I also like using this Grill at home when only wanting to cook small amount of items. You can fit upwards of five hamburgers and 6 hot dogs at a time. I will caution you, as this is a small unit there is no height adjustment for the actual grilling surface. If you do not want your food tentatively, you can burn them easily as there's a very close distance between the charcoal and the grill itself. This thing is small enough to fit in the back of your trunk or a small SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin TolentinoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Size DOES matter!
customer_reviews.text: I already own the 14” diameter version on this grill and although it is a quality grill, I always found it to be too small. I bought this one because I had company coming and I needed more grill capacity. I thought I would just use it in conjunction with the smaller one. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the extra 4” in diameter that the Jumbo Joe has was enough to handle all my cooking needs. It just seems to be a lot bigger, yet still easy to store and completely portable. I also like the ‘lid hold’ feature. Excellent grill.
customer_reviews.author: JPI

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this grill and buy another brand. During assembly, my wrist rubbed against the edge of the lid and nearly sliced through my skin. There is a jagged edge on the lid and the bottom bowl from the machine that forms the pieces. It was so sharp I considered it dangerous so I returned it. They should file or buff those edges to prevent injuries before painting.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P

customer_reviews.title: Very well made like any Weber
customer_reviews.text: This grill doesn't joke. Very well made like any Weber. Coals burn hot and long in this thing. It's the perfect size to grill food for 2-4 people. I can fit 4 huge chicken breasts on it, 6 hamburger patties and a whole rack of ribs easy. Very well made and sturdy. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward K

customer_reviews.title: Solid grill
customer_reviews.text: Works well and gives a nice charcoal flavor to foods. I have bought a couple of these over a few years and find them relatively easy to set up and use. Just be carefull not to overtighten the bottom and top vents otherwise they can be hard to move when opening and closing. I generally get about three years out of one before i think the bulid of residue on the sides makes me want to replace it witha new one.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Kaskoff

customer_reviews.title: There's nothing not to like. I am an amateur Weber collector > > ...
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing not to like. I am an amateur Weber collector > > only a dozen or so!. The new Jumbo Joe sits next to my Smokey Joe. I purchased the Rapidfire Chimney Starter to go with it and for use with my Smokey Joe and my 18" Bud Lite. All are working as expected. Assembly was pretty much easy. I like the new cover "latch". I use those black rubber bungee cords on some of the other Webers to keep the wind from disassembling the covers. Our patios are Saltillo tile and they chip the Weber ceramic when the wind dislodges the covers > > bungees prevent that from happening. Keep BBQing! AZSteve.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Steve

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful small grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill is used for my spouse and I. It is a great size for the two of us and easily holds 6 good size burgers. It cleans like a typical charcoal grill. We put it on a utility cart so we could easily move it from the garage to the outside with charcoal, utensils, wood chips and spices aboard.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Fields

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.  Cooks exactly like a 22” Weber—only portable.
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill! It cooks exactly like my 22” kettles so there are no surprises there. The lid bail is brilliant in how it doubles to keep the lid securely on for transport. Big enough to cook a LOT of food (I fed 4 people off of it for 5 days). Add a little $25 collapsible aluminum table and you are all set.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as other Weber products
customer_reviews.text: I love Weber products. I own an 18" Weber Smokey Mountain, a 22" Weber red Limited Edition kettle, a Weber charcoal chimney, and numerous mitts/tongs. I also have a collection of Weber rubs/seasonings and spices. But I was disappointed with this Jumbo Joe portable grill. Although the lid and bowl was the good quality I expected, the lid on this particular unit was warped. I had to bend it into shape to fit the bowl. It still isn't 100% right. The legs are thin aluminum and flimsy. If I had known this before ordering it, I would have shopped around for a higher quality portable charcoal grill.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Great charcoal grill for two people, either at home or out camping.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grill for a couple years now, and I'm very pleased! With the Slo n Sear insert, it can smoke or grill meats and other foods easily. Hot and fast or low and slow, it will work. Limitations: No, you can't do a full packer brisket. No, you can't do burgers or dogs for 20 people all at once. So really size is its main limitation, but for two people, it's ideal. Happy grilling!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Barber

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: I used to take the legs off of my Weber kettle grill and place the kettle into a cardboard box and slide the box into the back of my truck under the tonneau cover. Then I found this, it fits under the tonneau cover without problem and is a great grill for camping. I place the grill onto a Dutch oven table while camping. The size of the grill is more than adequate for my family of 3 and the food that is cooked on this is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and the perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Well made and the perfect size! You can fit a whole rack of babyback ribs on this. It's well constructed and easy to assemble. Can't go wrong (unless you're completely useless and can't assemble things without hurting yourself or losing self locking washers). I originally thought about the smaller version but am glad I went with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea L

customer_reviews.title: Overall, pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid grill that works well. Two issues: 1) Directions were not easily understood. 2) Metal wire that secures the top is worthless. If those are not big issues to you then the grill will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable grill
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and I was super excited waiting for it’s arrival. Put that bad boy together( the assembly was easy peasy) and fired up some charcoal. I love the portability of this grill without compromising too much on kettle size. I plan to take this guy camping and on future road trips. I’ve had Weber grills in the past and the never disappoint. Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chadia Ladbasri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: I live in the city and I wanted a small convenient, charcoal fired grill that cooks well and safely. This is it. I have it on a table top on a metal cutting board. It was easy to assemble and works like a Weber does. Highly recommend for small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Weber, what more can you say?
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping! We’re big on grilling, so this made the perfect addition to our camping setup. And it’s a Weber, so it works perfectly. Only thing I would change/improve is the ash catch. The small dish is difficult to remove without spilling the ashes, and the newer full sized models come with an enclosed ash catch that’s really useful. Maybe add that to a newer model of this. I’d certainly pay a few bucks more for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size for my wife and I...
customer_reviews.text: Now that our 4 daughters are off to college and life...my wife and I downgraded to a smaller grill. This one is “just” the right size. Seems to work pretty well. There is a learning curve to cooking on a much smaller grill...but this one seems to act the most like a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Gutschow

customer_reviews.title: 3:5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Good workhorse, but needs some minor enhancements. I bought and drilled a temp gauge tel-tru bq225 into lid and added a lever to the bottom vent because it's hard to adjust due to the short, hidden latch to open and close. Both lost a star and easy additions for ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: RICHDNJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this little portable grill for my BF for his birthday. Its an awesome little grill, the top holder makes it really easy to deal with, also makes it easy to carry when youre done and flip the handle up to the top. It keeps the lid closed and secure. Its a good sized grill too. We cooked 2 steaks and 3 burgers on it easily. Very nice grill, def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Tailgating, beach, picnic.
customer_reviews.text: Head to the beach and take this handy little Weber with you. It might be nice to have one a bit bigger, but then it wouldn't be portable. Cooks evenly just like a Weber and easy to clean. Perfect to throw in the back of your car for football games, beach, picnics. Coals heat evenly and quickly. Perfect little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: Just another Weber homerun!
customer_reviews.text: As always you get what you pay for. Weber is a great brand that always delivers. i have grilled and slow cooked on this thing and the results are impressive. The surface is actually large enough to do some indirect heat which is nice. The handle makes this thing a breeze to throw in your car and hit the road. It was a thought out design locking the lid with the handle making it easy to contain the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: we have a large smoker that we use for most things but sometimes i feel like the old fashioned flavor of charcoal grill. its the perfect size, very portable, cleans up easily and holds 3 steaks and some veggies at once. The only thing i miss is being able to adjust the distance from the coals, but hey, im satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joann M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable grill.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the size this grill for camping. It holds the lid well and cooks well. It was very easy to assemble and store when not in use. I have bought Weber products for decades. I also like to use hickory wood chunks to cook with instead of charcoal. This approach makes a wonderful campfire before you start cooking. The flavor is better for steaks and pork chops.
customer_reviews.author: Corvette #8

customer_reviews.title: Good tiny grill
customer_reviews.text: I like how compact it was and how easy it was to carry around. Decent grilling area as well. Good for about 4 to 5 people worth of hot dogs or burgers
customer_reviews.author: DeadNeck90

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with quality and design.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Bought this for an upcoming camping trip. Very large grill, still low profile. A couple of unique features - the slide that allows you to slide the lid back and hold it while you're flipping what ever is on the grill, and the support rod that hold the slide double to hold the lid down for transportation. Great design. A little more pricey than some of the others but worth the quality and features.
customer_reviews.author: STL Larry

customer_reviews.title: Like all Webers, it’s great
customer_reviews.text: It does what it’s supposed to; it travels well. I tried to use lump charcoal (I like the flavor), but it’s too shallow for big chunks of lump. I will use a mix of briquettes and either small lump or wood in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Baker

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little grill!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the Jumbo Joe! Well worth the extra cost to get the features you have on a full size Weber. Tall enough to sit on a table with out burning it, big enough to cook on with indirect heat, top and bottom adjustable air vents for temperature, AND the lid stand is absolutely brilliant. It will cost you more in end to buy anything less, so buy this one first!
customer_reviews.author: Circuitbreaker

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and lightweight and easy to carry with its great handle-Cooking surface is big and can accommodate more than you would think. I also love the deepness of the kettle so things are not burning--I wish the grill grate would have a flip-up part (like some of the non-portable ones have) to make for easy access to stir around the coals. Then this would be 10 stars! I love this grill and highly recommend it. It helped us cope with Covid 19 as we are cooking out in the park a lot(chgo city living) and it makes life tolerable. If its in your budget-get it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Healy

customer_reviews.title: Much more convenient than taking my larger 22 inch Weber to the park.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for taking to the park, much more convenient than taking my larger 22 inch Weber to the park. Also purchased the table through Amazon Had to cut grill grate to place under the Weber grill, works perfectly. - Table: Item model number 280312, Lifetime Folding Tailgate Camp Table with Grill Rack, White, - Grill: ASIN B0098HR0RC, Weber Jumbo Joe Charcoal Grill 18 Inch Black
customer_reviews.author: TROY

customer_reviews.title: The Jumbo Joe performs great for these two functions
customer_reviews.text: As a long time owner of the smaller Smokey Joe (which I love), I wanted to try a larger grill to be able to a) make rotisserie chicken), and b) cook for multiple people on occasion. The Jumbo Joe performs great for these two functions. Note that I have also purchased an Onlyfire 18.5 in rotisserie ring kit, which fits perfectly on the Jumbo Joe. Highly recommended -- nothing compares to charcoal grilling. I am not a fan of gas grilling.
customer_reviews.author: mrnuxi

customer_reviews.title: Capable Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to serve some steaks for the Easter pot luck so I put this grill in the trunk of my car and took it to my friends house. I grilled up 4 rib-eyes; each steak weighed 1.5 pounds. Seared the steaks on the hot side, slid them to finish on cool side, 2 at a time. It took about 20 mins total to cook all steaks after the coals were white hot. Very happy with the results. The steaks had a good crust on the outside and stayed pink, tender and juicy inside.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: its a weber
customer_reviews.text: well built and solid, great table top bbq pit, portable but still large enough to feed everyone in the family. was very easy to assemble, took about 15 minutes. great for grilling and smoking your food. bought to take to my camper in the country but I might get another just to have one at my home as my main grill. easy to control the temperature and save your charcoal too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for direct and indirect cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I love my little "Jumbo" grill. I travel full-time in my RV, so this grill was the perfect size for my needs. I use it for everything from cooking burgers to smoking ribs. I installed a thermometer in the lid which makes it great for slow indirect cooking. It is well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for two people. I currently own two other Webers, a large gas model and an electric model, and the Jumbo Joe is prefect for our needs. I've owed the 22 inch charcoal model and the small Smoky Joe in the past, and this model fits perfectly in between. Enough cooking area, uses less charcoal for the job, and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I took it on my trip to South Padre Island. It was large enough to cook for a family of four and more. We used it to cook steaks and also used it to use it as a fire pit for kids to cook s’mores. During the trip the lid stayed closed and did not rattle in the car. The clean up was easy. After dumping the ashes. I simply hosed it down and let it dry in the sun. It was ready to travel in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Choi

customer_reviews.title: Its a great grill!
customer_reviews.text: This a really good grill. We bought it because she thought it was cute and I wanted a Weber. I was concerned because of the height the grill might suck. Not the case. Its easy to get it to the temperature you want. Also holds temperature well and is easy to clean. To top it all off apparently its cute too. Easy to transport and great for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Javamon86

customer_reviews.title: It's the "Bomb"
customer_reviews.text: The grandson thinks it's the "Bomb". Pulled it out of the trunk the other day at the grocery store after some shopping . There's a small picnic area on the side of the building,I think it's for the employees. Fired the grill up and had some dinner,steak ,baked potato, asparagus, and corn. There was enough for me and him and two employees . He can't wait to do it again, he reminds me every time I see him.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We liked it so well we bought two! One for each house. My husband loves it. We also have a large gas grill, but he uses this one most of the time. It was fairly easy to put together, is nice looking, easy to clean, and doesn't take up a lot of space. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling or camping
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Bought this so I could leave my regular 22 inch Weber at home when camping. It travels well. I like the bale that secures the lid while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Acquaviva

customer_reviews.title: Great and purposeful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, easy to clean and perfect for small quantity grilling. We have a great larger charcoal grill but this one is perfect for when I'm just grilling for 2. Easy clean up, no waste of charcoal and it does a great job in trapping in all of the smoke for great taste.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTIAN GOMEZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for picnics or camping!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have a small bbq birthday in the park, and it was perfect. All the reviews are true for this product, Weber #1 in my book, size is great because it's portable but still a generous size for a small group! We had six of us and grilled 6 skewers with shrimp and veggies and additional fish. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Troup-Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Classic Barbecue grill
customer_reviews.text: I had grown tired of my gas grill which never seemed to get hot enough to really sear the meat and decided to go back to the roots and get a charcoal grill. After much deliberation I decided to get this tried and true classic. I really like how they have improved the model to hold the lid so I'm not having to set it on the ground or find someplace to set it while its hot. No regrets at all. This grill is great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brixius

customer_reviews.title: Campsite Grilling style in your backyard!
customer_reviews.text: Look no further if you are looking for a Weber grill that has same capacity as regular grill but half of the packing size! In Taiwan, the whole family with few friends sit on folding chair in a circle outdoor and grill (with direct heat) our own foods during Mid-Autumn Festival. The Smokey Joe could only fit 2~3 people around it and this Jumbo Joe is perfect for 4~6 people surround it. You cook WITH your guest instead FOR them. This is like bring campsite grilling style to your own backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I love our BBQ. When we moved in together we couldn't wait to get one and this one has been awesome. We have used it too many times to count and it's holding up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right size. Nifty handle.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the handle works. Easily portable. Just right for 2-4 people. Use a charcoal chimney and fire starters and it will work like a charm. Assembly is a little tricky because of the way 3 pieces meet in the center - not too difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Teach

customer_reviews.title: Weber is the bomb
customer_reviews.text: Love my Weber’s. I have a big one but needed something to throw in the back of the truck. You can cook anything on a Weber kettle. I’ve done slow cook bbq and fast grilling and everything tastes great. Love how it holds the lid as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gray

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is doing what I bought t for. I smoke small batches of Spices and herbs. It’s easy to clean and I dismantle it to wash in the dishwasher. I have to repeat, I use this just for Smoking Spices and Herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in-between size
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I had no idea this size Weber existed until I saw a YouTube video on it. It is a perfect size for use on RV trips and just large enough yet fits easily in the RV's storage compartment.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with a Weber - and this is no exception. We have had Webers for years - but this is perfect - and very portable in case you want to have a grill somewhere else on your property besides your deck or patio. Plus it would work perfectly for traveling if you wanted a grill for that. It works just as well as the full-sized Weber - but just a smaller size. (But not so small you can't fit anything on it!)
customer_reviews.author: MN Mom

customer_reviews.title: You will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Best little grill you can find. Just buy it you will not regret it. It can feed a full size family with ease. Put a cast iron grate in it and it will make amazing steaks. Also works as a good smoker with some skill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for travel trailer!
customer_reviews.text: We totally wore our other one out and discovered this larger one. My husband LOVES it! We store it in a large trash bag while traveling and he loves the handle keeping it closed, especially if he has to move it while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Rita T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, perfect portable charcoal BBQ grill
customer_reviews.text: Love it, perfect portable charcoal BBQ grill. Good size for the RV or the Park. The only con is that it didn't come with a Temp gauge. But that is an easy fix. Would definitely recommend to anyone who likes charcoal/wood smoked food.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Page

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over 3 months and I love it. I've always had a gas grill, so this was my first foray with Charcoal. Get the large chimney starter and lump charcoal. Royal oak lump is the best
customer_reviews.author: John and Lori Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Love me my Jumbo Joe!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy! I have had this grill for close to a year now and have definitely put it to the test...ribs, salmon, steaks, burgers, you name it. Great durability and heat distribution. Make sure you get the hinged grate as an accompaniment, makes redistributing coals a much easier process.
customer_reviews.author: Van Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Big enough to cook for an army small enough to carry
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the smokey joe 14 inch. (lost somewhere at the bottom of the indian river). I decided to trade up. The Good: The grill size is great. The locking bail-lid/lid-rest combo is incredible useful. Kind of flattened out on the lid, makes it more portable. The bad: The top vent being on a more flat surface than the larger or smaller weber grills tends to heat up the handle hot enough to burn your hands if a casual breeze blows the heat in that direct. Wear gloves. Other than that small caveat its a wonderful piece of gear
customer_reviews.author: Techyy555

customer_reviews.title: In love!
customer_reviews.text: We are in love with our Weber Jumbo Joe Charcoal Bar B Q. Big enough to feed a feast. Small enough to be portable. Great construction. Durable materials. Easy set up. Easy cleaning. The hook to hold the lid is a 10. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: michelle camacho

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best portable little grill ever. You pay a little more, but well worth it. Very sturdy, well made, solid and has enough room for direct or indirect cooking. I use wood and coals in it, and the lid is nice and deep. This is perfect for two people and upwards of 4 depending on what your grilling. The only drawback is empyting the coals...it's pretty much impossible to get the little plate out to dump them, so you have to scoop out the oldies w/a big spoon or somethibng, but that's a miniscule price to pay for such a great grill. I've had a couple other small grills and this is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Misuk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size !
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size grill for camping, tail gating and going where fire wood is not allowed. It's small size makes it ideal for road trips and still has enough cooking capacity for 2 adults !
customer_reviews.author: PA Krieger

customer_reviews.title: The best grill I've had yet.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through many charcoal grills but this is the best one yet. It was easy to assemble and even easier to use. It takes up very little space in my screen room and having the bracket to hold the lid when I am using the grill is a very handy feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: so good! Have owned the regular Smokey Joe and was ...
customer_reviews.text: So, so good! Have owned the regular Smokey Joe and was not pleased. Poor ventilation. No bottom vents. Decided to buy the Jumbo Joe for camping, etc. Loved it on first use. Easy to assemble. Vents top and bottom. Top held shut for easy carrying and storage. Perfect size. Will probably break this out at home on occasion in place of the gas grill to get some nice smoke flavor once in a while. I highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: Does not seem to be well engineered; close it and no more heat is generated and it wont cook well. does not seem to have good air circulation if closed. not happy and disappointed
customer_reviews.author: iajarmeh

customer_reviews.title: JuMBo Joooooeeeee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Absolutely Recommend the Weber Jumbo Joe to Anyone Who Loves to Grill on the Go. The Jumbo Joe Has a Large Grilling Surface & It Provides and Retains a Tremendous Amount of Heat Needed for Just About Anything One Would Care to Grill.
customer_reviews.author: TiMoTHy FoSTeR

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd weber. I've got a 22 inch I use at home, a smokey joe I used to take camping and now the Jumbo Joe. If I had gotten the Jumbo Joe first it could be used exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: schutz

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Best grill yet. So portable. I live in upstairs apartment and this is perfect for safe travels up and down. Get the Weber hinged grill insert and Weber Sears all and Weber chimney. Perfect combo.
customer_reviews.author: Royce

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is far better than I expected. I thought I was getting a big Smoky Joe, but this is more like a table top version of an original kettle. I've been doing 3 lbs bone in Boston Butts, and it smoked them perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Grill
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill so much! I didn’t need something large since I only grill for 2 of us at most and this is perfect. For my daughter’s birthday I tested the limits of this bad boy and grilled enough burgers and hot dogs for 12 people. It took 2 separate batches BUT I was able to get it done. Absolutely love this grill and can’t wait to take it out camping.
customer_reviews.author: NajlaSidd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for tailgating or camping!
customer_reviews.text: This grill has been great for many different trips we have taken. It's compact size makes it really easy to bring where ever we go and it is big enough to grill for a family!
customer_reviews.author: C Hal

customer_reviews.title: Really nice portable grill
customer_reviews.text: The grill is well built and nicely portable with the wire holder that holds the lid on for transport. We have a Weber gas grill but can't take it with you and really enjoy the charcoal flavor from Smokey Joe.
customer_reviews.author: Hndymn

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for small grill outs (doable for 4-8 people)
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for small grill outs (doable for 4-8 people). the strap for holding the lid on can get bent out of shape but just remove it and bend it back if that happens. the holder for keeping the lid off the ground while flipping burgers is setup perfectly. a bit pricey compared to others in the same size but this one is solid and ive always liked the round grills (in larger form) anyhow, very even cook area.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable grill
customer_reviews.text: Awesome portable grill. I was debating on buying the larger egg or the portable grill. I decided on the portable grill paired with the webber portable table. Was very easy to put together , use and clean. Amazon's two day shipping got the grill to us on time for our 4th of July barbecue. I would highly recommend this grill if you want a portable grill to take anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: LEM

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PURCHASE !!
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered in record time. Unpacked and assembled (easily) in about ten minutes ! Looks good. Appears to be very hi quality. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: nice but the extra size has done nothing great for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it having previously having the Little Smoker, nice but the extra size has done nothing great for me. The biggest plus is the wire handle that keeps the lid on, I could care less for the lid holder, but the closer handle is great!
customer_reviews.author: J.Romans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Best idea ever to buy this grill
customer_reviews.text: Really good bbq grill. Made my family and friends happy. Cooks the food evenly. Perfect size for a crowd. Fast shipping and great packaging. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Little Package
customer_reviews.text: Great grill that has tons of surface area while still being very portable. Bottom vents really help in getting the coals ripping hot (as opposed to side vents). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ez

customer_reviews.title: We live in an apartment by the beach, and ...
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment by the beach, and we aren't allowed to leave our grills out. This with the table gives us so much flexibility where we grill. We can take this down to the beach, and avoid using the communal grills, set it up in the communal patio by our place. or we can set it up by a green patch by our apartment when it gets cold out. Very durable, and I was impressed by the size. It's just as large as my neighbors grills, but easier to move around. I can't wait to take this on a road trip!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Just right for the tabletop
customer_reviews.text: We had a smaller version of this Weber grill, but we are loving this larger style. We use this grill almost every day , easy and convenient !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good BBQ
customer_reviews.text: Webber is well built and it works great. this is small enough to be portable and big enough to cook for 4-6 people. having used it for both, I almost wish I had the smaller one and the 22" one. It is a good in between choice, but it is really big for 2 people and not big enough for the accessories that let the bigger one do so much.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo Joe I love you man!
customer_reviews.text: just perfect! I had an identical grill just smaller that was nicely portable but just too too small for most of my grilling needs i couldnt get the fire just like I wanted in a smaller bowl but this is just right!I prefer wood chunks to grill with so I've also added the use of the Webber compact rapid fire chimney starter to get the ball rolling great combo! I am hoping I can cook a whole chicken in here, that I have not even attempted yet but for everything else I've tried just awesome! <3
customer_reviews.author: S Kemp

customer_reviews.title: This grill is Fantastic! Great bargain and bigger than I thought it ...
customer_reviews.text: This grill is Fantastic! Great bargain and bigger than I thought it would be. Perfect size for not having to fire up my regular size grill for single dinners at lunch or evenings for me and my wife since we are empty nesters now! Because of the price I also bought 2 at the same time for us and my daughter as a house warming gift.
customer_reviews.author: Dedoub

customer_reviews.title: Skip the Smokey Joe and go straight to the Jumbo
customer_reviews.text: I should have. The Smokey Joe is just too small. This one is just right or the RV. I can get a cedar plank in here, and easily set up a real 2 zone grill.
customer_reviews.author: David Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grill that cooks more food than I expect. Well built and easy to take along on a camping trip. I also love the way it holds the cover open. It’s just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Well built, easy assembly and great to cook on. Worth every penny. Best part is the ability to expand by using accessories from the regular 18" grills. Lots of room to work with. Toss corn, beets and potatoes on the coals and grill salmon and lamb chops up top. Man. So nice to work on. Good heat retention. One chimney of hardwood charcoal can run for hours. Ideal for our space outside on the balcony!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and portable!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is awesome! I love that I don’t have to deal with cleaning my 22” Weber grill every time we want a serving for just 2 or 3 people. The cleanup is easier and I love the portability, and of course its good, it’s a Weber!
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Size is everything
customer_reviews.text: It's a great grill if you cook for 4. For some it will be perfect. It didn't fit our family. It is too big for car camping and not big enough for a gathering. If it fit in the car I probably would have kept it. Instead I bought a smaller grill for camping and a larger home size for gatherings.
customer_reviews.author: I K.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS GRILL
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS GRILL. Do not be fooled by its size, this grill will cook your food up phenomenally! Great for camping, or even backyard use as well. The Jumbo Joe grills up food impressively well. My favorite feature would have to be the carrying handle. Someone was thinking with that design feature. Great buy and extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jaye00

customer_reviews.title: love Webers
customer_reviews.text: love the look of it. The cover has a place to the side and not on the ground..Haven't used it yet..Living in New England, it is almost put away for the cooler weather..still using my Smokey Joe..which I also love. But the bottom vent doesn't stay on, I believe the screw rotted off, but I got my moneys worth from that..love Weber products.
customer_reviews.author: Salisbury beachbum

customer_reviews.title: Quality but needs a thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This overall is a great grill. Weber quality and great surface area for a table top. Only issue is that I had to install a thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: Use it for camping, tailgating, etc. It's just like my bigger weber but easier transport. I bought a small cover for it and just store it in my deck next to its big brother.
customer_reviews.author: derickav

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to store under the shelves and to take out when I want to use it, and it's plenty big enough for one or two people.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grilling anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping, grilling at the beach, patio, or back yard. Weber speaks for itself. You get what you pay for. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney R.

product_meta.title: Weber Jumbo Joe Charcoal Grill 18 Inch Black
product_meta.description: Travel with taste, or grill up a quick meal on your patio with the Jumbo Joe portable charcoal grill. The compact size with larger grilling area and convenient carry handle is perfect for any weekend getaway or spontaneous day at the beach. Combustion by-products produced when using this product contain chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer, birth defects, or other reproductive harm.
feature_bullets: Travel with taste, or grill up a quick meal on your patio with the Jumbo Joe portable charcoal grill. The compact size with larger grilling area and convenient carry handle is perfect for any weekend getaway or spontaneous day at the beach. Combustion by-products produced when using this product contain chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer, birth defects, or other reproductive harm.
Holds up to eight burgers made with a Weber burger press
Compact and lightweight for grilling on the go
Porcelain-enameled lid and bowl retain heat, and won’t rust or peel
The Tuck-N-Carry lid lock doubles as a lid holder to avoid placing the lid on the ground
Dampers allow you to easily control the temperature inside your grill
3D interactive assembly instructions for this product are available through the free BILT app.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
